appendix.title: OpenICF Interfaces
appendix.para: This chapter describes all of the interfaces supported by the OpenICF framework, along with notes about their implementation. Specific connectors may support only a subset of these interfaces.

section.title: AttributeNormalizer
section.para: Normalize attributes to ensure consistent filtering.

section.title: Authenticate
section.para: Provides simple authentication with two parameters, presumed to be a user name and password. If the connector does not implement the AuthenticateOp interface it can not be used in OpenIDM to provide pass-through authentication.

section.title: Create
section.para: Create an object and its uid.

section.title: Delete
section.para: Delete an object by its uid.

section.title: Resolve Username
section.para: Resolve an object to its uid based on its username.

section.title: Schema
section.para: Describe supported object types, operations, and options.

section.title: Script On Resource
section.para: Allow script execution on the resource.

section.title: Search
section.para: Connectors that implement only this interface can only be used for reconciliation operations.

section.title: Sync
section.para: Poll for synchronization events, which are native changes to target objects.

section.title: Test
section.para: Test the connection configuration, including connecting to the resource.

section.title: Update
section.para: Allows an authorized caller to update (modify or replace) objects on the target resource.

section.title: Update Attribute Values
section.para: Allows an authorized caller to update (modify or replace) attribute values on the target resource. This operation is more advanced than the UpdateOp operation, and provides better performance and atomicity semantics.
